learning_outcomes.description: Assess the treatment requirements of wastewater streams, based on physicochemical and biological characterisation parameters as derived from quantitative characterization methods.
Describe the scientific and engineering working principles of wastewater and biosolids treatment unit operations using physics, chemistry, and biology concepts to underpin engineering solutions.
Characterise the size and composition of waste sludge streams, including chemical characterization, and identify the potential resource value as well as the hazard level of the sludge.
Assess the sustainability aspects of wastewater management using environmental, social, and economic criteria.
Use scientific and engineering principles to design, analyse, troubleshoot and retrofit wastewater treatment processes.

assessments.due_date:
Problem Portfolio 1 29/08/2025 4:00 pm

Problem Portfolio 2 26/09/2025 4:00 pm

Problem Portfolio 3 24/10/2025 4:00 pm
assessments.task_description:
Problem Portfolios are formal assessment exercises requiring detailed analysis and thoughtful responses. You will submit these three times during the course as part of your evaluation.

  • Problem Portfolio 1 covering Weeks 1–4, due Friday 29/08/25 at 4 PM
  • Problem Portfolio 2 covering Weeks 5–8, due Friday 26/09/25 at 4 PM
  • Problem Portfolio 3 covering Weeks 9–11, due Friday 24/10/25 at 4 PM

Portfolios must be typed using word processing software, converted to PDF format, and submitted electronically.

We recommend completing the exercises as you progress through each week. Exercises comprising each Portfolio must be submitted together as a single PDF.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Problem Portfolios are submitted electronically through Blackboard. A Turnitin link will be made available before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Blackboard quizzes (multiple-choice) to be submitted electronically covering the content of the Laboratory Practicals and Site Visit to the Wastewater Treatment Plant.

Quizzes associated with the laboratory practicals are run in class at the end of the pracs in weeks 4 and 8, the quiz associated with the site visit is done after the visit in week 11.

Quizzes are submitted electronically using a link provided on Blackboard. You are only allowed one attempt. Once started, the quiz must be completed within one (1) hour.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submissions independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quizzes are submitted electronically through a Blackboard link provided.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Closed book exam on all course content. Required reference material and key equations provided in the exam paper. Internal students sit as a central paper based in-person invigilated exam. External students will sit as a Zoom invigilated exam.

Format: Multiple-choice, Short answer, Problem solving

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Course content covered in the lectures: 

  • Introduction to wastewater treatment
  • Wastewater characterisation
  • Preliminary treatment
  • Primary treatment
  • Fundamentals of biological treatment
  • Activated sludge process
  • Settling of activated sludge
  • Variations of the activated sludge process
  • Stabilisation ponds
  • Fixed-film treatment
  • Nutrients removal (Nitrogen)
  • Nutrients removal (Phosphorus)
  • Sludge treatment and management of biosolids
  • Next generation technologies

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Course content covered in the lectures: Introduction to wastewater treatment Wastewater characterisation Preliminary treatment Primary treatment Fundamentals of biological treatment Activated sludge process Settling of activated sludge Variations of the activated sludge process Stabilisation ponds Fixed-film treatment Nutrients removal (Nitrogen) Nutrients removal (Phosphorus) Sludge treatment and management of biosolids Next generation technologies
